artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Funazu Chūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 334.15; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 110, p. 283.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two men running on a wooden bridge; frontmost man is barefoot, wearing grey, black and red armor on his body and legs, with bare arms, wearing a green garment with brown scrolling vines, holding a blade-tipped spear with a pink cloth attached to the end; man in background wears zori with platforms and a red garment with green flowers; orange moon low in sky in LLQ
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Mirror of Famous Generals of Great Japan (Dai Nihon meishō kagami 大日本名将鑑)
title: Ushiwakamaru, Son of Distinguished Family and Later Iyo-no-kami Minamoto Yoshitsune and Saitō Musashibō Benkei
